title: Progressive Bilateral Sensorineural Hearing Loss (Autoimmune Etiology)
chief_complaint: I've noticed my hearing has gotten worse over the last several years. I wear hearing aids now, but they aren't helping enough in meetings or at church.

problem_summary.course: Progressive; significant decline (15-35 dB) noted over the last 12 years compared to previous test.
problem_summary.associated_symptoms: Intermittent bilateral tinnitus (not bothersome); some imbalance (attributed to heart condition).
problem_summary.functional_impact: Reduced benefit from current CIC hearing aids in complex listening environments like meetings and church.
problem_summary.goals_motivation: Desires better hearing benefit in social and religious settings.

history.present_illness: Patient reports bilateral hearing loss progressing over several years. Currently wears CIC hearing aids from another clinic but finds benefit insufficient.
history.otologic_history: No other otologic symptoms reported. Family history of hearing loss (sister).
history.medical_psych_history: Recent heart stent placement. Reports imbalance attributed to heart condition. Subsequent medical workup revealed positive Western Blot for inner ear antigen antibodies (Autoimmune Inner Ear Disease).
history.patient_goals: Improve hearing in meetings and church.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Bilateral sloping sensorineural hearing loss. Right ear: slight loss 250-1000 Hz, sloping to moderate/moderately-severe 1.5-6k Hz, profound at 8k Hz. Left ear: slight/mild loss 250-1000 Hz, sloping to severe at 8k Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.key_findings: SRT scores agree with PTA. Word recognition scores (WRS) indicate moderate difficulty with speech clarity.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.key_findings: Ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes generally within normal limits 500-2000 Hz, elevated or absent at 4000 Hz. Reflex decay negative at 500 and 1000 Hz.

overall_audiologic_summary: The patient presents with a bilateral, symmetric, sloping sensorineural hearing loss that has progressed significantly (15-35 dB drop) since the previous evaluation. Speech understanding is fair (60-70%), indicating moderate difficulty with clarity even when speech is loud enough. Middle ear function is normal. The progression was later identified as Autoimmune Inner Ear Disease via Western Blot.
counseling_points: Your hearing has changed significantly since your last test, particularly in the high pitches which provide speech clarity.
The medical tests ordered by the otologist (Western Blot) came back positive, indicating an autoimmune cause for this recent drop in hearing.
Because your word recognition scores are around 60-70%, hearing aids will make sounds louder, but you may still struggle with clarity in noisy places like church.
Your current CIC (tiny) hearing aids may no longer be strong enough or have the necessary features to handle your current hearing levels.
You are medically cleared for new amplification that can better address your current hearing profile.
notes_for_actor: You are frustrated that your current hearing aids aren't working as well as they used to.
You attribute your imbalance to your heart condition (recent stent), not your ears.
You are cooperative but concerned about why your hearing is getting worse.
